snippet: The convictions of five officers in connection with the shooting of unarmed individuals have been thrown out, and a former officer has been twice acquitted of killing an unarmed man.
abstract: Campaign to prosecute New Orleans police officers for crimes committed in wake of Hurricane Katrina has suffered series of stunning reversals; judge has thrown out convictions of five officers in connection with shooting of unarmed individuals, and a former officer has been twice acquitted of killing unarmed man.
lead_paragraph: The convictions of five officers in connection with the shooting of unarmed individuals have been thrown out, and a former officer has been twice acquitted of killing an unarmed man.

headline.main: Post-Katrina Police Prosecutions in New Orleans Face Setbacks
headline.print_headline: Post-Katrina Police Prosecutions in New Orleans Face Setbacks
